rules.name: _General issue transitioned rulesaas
rules.description:
Rules that have similar trigger needs to be grouped to optimize general resource utilization. The most amount of time rules executions finish with category NO_ACTIONS_PERFORMED. Rules with trigger on issue transition showed themseves as the most time-consuming.

This rule includes the following sub-rules/tasks:
 * TQA slack notification AUTO-390
 * Send API request on specific transitions - global AUTO-790
 * NPS - General - On Faster/Easier Story/EPIC Closure - Email Sending
 * OM2R - On Outage/MW Status Change


created as per AUTO-851.

Regards,
Risk Management Team
productivity@crossover.com

value.subject: Invitation to schedule the Online Cognitive Aptitude Test
value.body: Dear {{Candidate name}}, At Crossover, we are committed to working with the world's top 1% of global talent and expect all of our partners to deliver at a high-pace with excellent quality. You are being asked to schedule a slot to take a cognitive aptitude test in an online proctored mode. Please follow the guidelines below: Use this link to schedule a 30-minute slot The deadline for scheduling the slot is Wednesday at midnight UTC We recommend to carefully read the "Trilogy Operations Cognitive Aptitude Test Policy & Preparation" guidelines at this link , especially the 2nd bullet about having Zoom installed on your mobile phone before the session starts. Your score will be sent to you over email within a week from taking the test and will be shared with your management as a data point. Best regards, Risk Management team www.crossover.com

rules.name: Proctored_test_send_email_SFIT-12624

value.subject: Please schedule your Proctored CCAT Exam
value.body:
Dear {{issue.customfield_46800}}, One of the things everyone that works with Crossover loves is how smart all of their colleagues are. When you work exclusively with peers that have strong problem solving, language and critical thinking skills, you are able to have higher bandwidth conversations and collaborate more efficiently. When you went through our recruiting process, the CCAT test was one of the first assessments you completed. In this first week of RemoteU, we readminister the same test with a different set of questions and in a proctored environment to make sure that all of our partners produce scores under the same supervised conditions. Below you will find the link to schedule a 30-minute proctored CCAT. This is a high-stakes exam and we want you to score above the 85th percentile, the same minimum score required to pass the recruiting assessment you did recently. To make sure you do your best, here are a few tips:
  • Research shows that people perform their best on standardized tests in the morning hours. We suggest you schedule a session during your morning hours
  • Take a few minutes to read Criteria Corps What to expect page so you are familiar with the types of questions on the test.
  • Remember that CCAT is a timed, 15-minute test where you are not penalized for incorrect answers. During RemoteU you are rigorously coached to prioritize quality and accuracy over speed and productivity. That strategy is not what you want to follow with CCAT. Watch the clock and make sure you answer as many questions as you can in the 15-minute period.
  • Read the Trilogy Operations Cognitive Aptitude Test Policy & Preparation , document and note what is required for joining the proctored session.
There is no reason that everyone should not achieve the same score that they scored during the application process unless they took the test a bunch of times or did not oblige the restrictions on calculators and internet search. Please use this link o schedule the 30 minute proctored CCAT before Thursday of your first week of RemoteU. Best regards, Risk Management team www.crossover.com

Dear {{Manager name}},
 
As part of the weekly reviews performed by the Risk Management team, we often find items that we believe could be insightful for managers. 
 
This time we would like to share some findings that you might find interesting about {{Contractor name}}.  We think theres a wrong usage of the Guidelines for Success for the {{Infraction Category}} category on the week that started on {{Last review date}} as {{Description}} (timecards are in UTC timezone).

We hope you find this information useful. Please let us know if you have any questions or comments, we'll be glad to help.

FIELD_INLINE_SCRIPT:
package com.devfactory.spec.services

import com.atlassian.jira.component.ComponentAccessor
import com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchProvider
import com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchResults
import com.atlassian.jira.jql.parser.JqlQueryParser
import com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.PagerFilter
import com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.IssueLink
import com.atlassian.jira.issue.Issue
import com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomField
import com.atlassian.jira.mail.Email
import javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart
import javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart
import javax.mail.internet.MimeUtility
import com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueManager
import com.atlassian.jira.user.ApplicationUser
import com.atlassian.query.Query
import com.atlassian.jira.issue.CustomFieldManager
import com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.IssueLinkManager


processIssues()

def processIssues() {
    JqlQueryParser jqlQueryParser = ComponentAccessor.getComponent(JqlQueryParser)
    SearchProvider searchProvider = ComponentAccessor.getComponent(SearchProvider)
    IssueManager issueManager = ComponentAccessor.getIssueManager()
    IssueLinkManager issueLinkManager = ComponentAccessor.getIssueLinkManager()
    ApplicationUser user = ComponentAccessor.getJiraAuthenticationContext().getLoggedInUser()
    String csv = "P2, Status, P1, P1 Assignee, P1 Status, Company, Component, Approval ETA, Updated, Epic, Epic Status\n"
    Query query = jqlQueryParser.parseQuery("type = L2-Spec AND project = SPEC AND status not in ('Cancelled')")
    CustomFieldManager customFieldManager = ComponentAccessor.getCustomFieldManager()
    def customFields = [:]
    customFields.put("Company", customFieldManager.getCustomFieldObjectByName("Company"))
    customFields.put("Approval ETA", customFieldManager.getCustomFieldObjectByName("Approval ETA"))
    def date = Calendar.getInstance(TimeZone.getTimeZone('GMT')).time
    SearchResults results = searchProvider.search(query, user, PagerFilter.getUnlimitedFilter())
    results.getIssues().each {documentIssue ->
        def issue = issueManager.getIssueObject(documentIssue.id)
        collectLinks(issue, issueLinkManager).each{ issueLink ->
            csv = csv + handleData(issue, issueLink, issueLinkManager, customFields)
        }
    }
    // log.error(csv)
    sendEmail("anastasia.powell@devfactory.com", "manimaran.selvan@aurea.com", "Custom Report - ${date}", "This is a custom report.\nThe report is attached in this email!\nReport Generated at, ${date}.", csv, "custom_report_${date.format('yyyyMMddHHmmss')}.csv")
    "Execution finished"
}

def collectLinks(Issue issue, IssueLinkManager issueLinkManager) {
    def collection = []
    collection.addAll(issueLinkManager.getOutwardLinks(issue.id))
    collection.addAll(issueLinkManager.getInwardLinks(issue.id))
    // collection.addAll(issueLinkManager.  getIssueLinks(issue.id))
    collection
}

def handleData(Issue issue, IssueLink issueLink, IssueLinkManager issueLinkManager, Map<String, CustomField> customFields) {
    def linkedIssue = issueLink.sourceObject.key == issue.key ? issueLink.destinationObject : issueLink.sourceObject
    def record = ""
    if(linkedIssue.issueType.name == "L1-Spec" && linkedIssue.status.name != "Cancelled") {
        collectLinks(linkedIssue, issueLinkManager).each{ innerIssueLink ->
            def innerLinkedIssue = innerIssueLink.sourceObject.key == linkedIssue.key ? innerIssueLink.destinationObject : innerIssueLink.sourceObject
            if(innerLinkedIssue.issueType.name == "Epic") {
                record = [
                        issue.key,
                        issue.status.name,
                        linkedIssue.key,
                        linkedIssue.assignee?.name,
                        linkedIssue.status.name,
                        linkedIssue.getCustomFieldValue(customFields["Company"]),
                        linkedIssue.components[0]?.name,
                        linkedIssue.getCustomFieldValue(customFields["Approval ETA"]),
                        linkedIssue.updated,
                        innerLinkedIssue.key,
                        innerLinkedIssue.status.name
                ].join(", ")
                record = record + "\n"
            }
        }
    }
    record
}

def sendEmail(String to, String cc, String subject, String body, String attachmentString, String attachmentFileName) {

    log.error "Attempting to send email..."
    def mailServer = ComponentAccessor.getMailServerManager().getDefaultSMTPMailServer()
    if (mailServer) {
        Email email = new Email(to)
        email.setCc(cc)
        email.setSubject(subject)
        email.setBody(body)
        def mp = new MimeMultipart("mixed")
        def bodyPart = new MimeBodyPart()
        bodyPart.setContent(attachmentString, "text/plain")
        bodyPart.setFileName(MimeUtility.encodeText(attachmentFileName))
        email.setMultipart(mp)
        mp.addBodyPart(bodyPart)
        mailServer.send(email)
        log.error("Mail sent to (${to})) with cc (${cc}))")
    } else {
        log.warn("Please make sure that a valid mailServer is configured")
    }
}
